Description: Limestone relief of Iry and Inet: finely carved low relief panel with representations of Iry and his wife Inet, wearing a choker of vertically strung beads above a broad collar, seated on either side of an offering-table bearing stylized half-loaves of bread. Above the table is an enumeration of common food- and drink-offerings. At the top is a line of text naming the two persons; in the line at the bottom there is a standard offering-formula. The only surviving colour is the black on the wigs of the two people.
Curator's comments: This slab has three companion slabs 1896,0511.9, 1896,0511.10, 1896,0511.11. Bibliography: A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], 'Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo' (Ravenna, 1998), p.278 [269]; 'Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt' [exhibition catalogue] (Japan, 1999-2000), [16]; E. Russmann, 'Eternal Egypt : masterworks of ancient art from the British Museum' , (New York, 2001), pp.72-73 [6]; B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 203. G. Robins, 'Women in Ancient Egypt' (Cambridge, Mass., 1993), p. 158, fig 66.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.3)
Russmann 2001 / Eternal Egypt: Masterworks of Ancient Art from the British Museum (6)
